cluster-describe.name: cluster-describe
cluster-describe.description: Describe the YAML config of a cluster.

--alter.name: --alter
--alter.description: Alter the number of partitions, replica assignment, and/or configuration for a topic.

--config.name: --config
--config.description: A topic configuration override for the topic being created or altered.

--delete-config.name: --delete-config
--delete-config.description: A topic configuration override to be removed for an existing topic.

--describe.name: --describe
--describe.description: List details for the given topics.

--exclude-internal.name: --exclude-internal
--exclude-internal.description: Exclude internal topics when running list or describe command.

--force.name: --force
--force.description: Assume yes for all queries and do not prompt.

--if-exists.name: --if-exists
--if-exists.description: If set when altering or deleting topics, the action will only execute if the topic exists.

--if-not-exists.name: --if-not-exists
--if-not-exists.description: If set when creating topics, the action will only execute if the topic does not already exist.

--partitions.name: --partitions
--partitions.description: The number of partitions for the topic being created or altered.

--replica-assignment.name: --replica-assignment
--replica-assignment.description: A list of manual partition-to-broker assignments for the topic being created or altered.

--replication-factor.name: --replication-factor
--replication-factor.description: The replication factor for each partition in the topic being created.

--topic.name: --topic
--topic.description: The topic to be create, alter, describe, or delete.

--topics-with-overrides.name: --topics-with-overrides
--topics-with-overrides.description: If set when describing topics, only show topics that have overridden configs.

--unavailable-partitions.name: --unavailable-partitions
--unavailable-partitions.description: If set when describing topics, only show partitions whose leader is not available.

--under-replicated-partitions.name: --under-replicated-partitions
--under-replicated-partitions.description: If set when describing topics, only show under replicated partitions.

--zookeeper.name: --zookeeper
--zookeeper.description: Zookeeper connection string. WARNING: This'll overwrite the selected cluster value.

kafka-configs.name: kafka-configs
kafka-configs.description: Manage configs for a topic, broker, client, user.

--add-config.name: --add-config
--add-config.description: Key-value pairs of configs to add. Format: key=value.

--alter.name: --alter
--alter.description: Alter the configuration for the entity.

--bootstrap-server.name: --bootstrap-server
--bootstrap-server.description: The Kafka broker(s) to connect to. NOTE: This'll overwrite the selected cluster value.

--command-config.name: --command-config
--command-config.description: Property file containing configs to be passed to the admin client.

--delete-config.name: --delete-config
--delete-config.description: Key-value pairs of configs to remove. Format: key=value.

--describe.name: --describe
--describe.description: List configs for the given entity.

--entity-default.name: --entity-default
--entity-default.description: Default entity name for clients, users, and brokers.

--entity-name.name: --entity-name
--entity-name.description: Name of the entity (topic name, client id, user principal name, broker id).

--entity-type.name: --entity-type
--entity-type.description: Type of the entity (topic, client, user, broker).

--force.name: --force
--force.description: Assume yes for all queries and do not prompt.

--zookeeper.name: --zookeeper
--zookeeper.description: Zookeeper connection string. NOTE: This'll overwrite the selected cluster value.

--bootstrap-server.name: --bootstrap-server
--bootstrap-server.description: The Kafka broker(s) to connect to. NOTE: This'll overwrite the selected cluster value.

--consumer-property.name: --consumer-property
--consumer-property.description: A way to pass user-defined properties in the form key=value to the consumer.

--consumer.config.name: --consumer.config
--consumer.config.description: Consumer config properties file. Note that --consumer-property takes precedence over this config.

--enable-systest-events.name: --enable-systest-events
--enable-systest-events.description: Log lifecycle events of the consumer in addition to logging consumed messages.

--formatter.name: --formatter
--formatter.description: The name of a class to use for formatting kafka messages for display.

--from-beginning.name: --from-beginning
--from-beginning.description: Start with the earliest message present in the log rather than the latest message.

--group.name: --group
--group.description: The consumer group id of the consumer.

--isolation-level.name: --isolation-level
--isolation-level.description: Set to read_committed in order to filter out transactional messages which are not committed.

--max-messages.name: --max-messages
--max-messages.description: The maximum number of messages to consume before exiting. Defaults to continual consumption.

--offset.name: --offset
--offset.description: The offset id to consume from. A non-negative integer, 'earliest', or 'latest'.

--partition.name: --partition
--partition.description: The partition to consume from. Starts from the end unless --offset is set.

--property.name: --property
--property.description: The properties to initialize the message formatter.

--skip-message-on-error.name: --skip-message-on-error
--skip-message-on-error.description: If there is an error when processing a message, skip it rather than halting.

--timeout-ms.name: --timeout-ms
--timeout-ms.description: If specified, exit if no message is available for consumption for the specified interval.

--whitelist.name: --whitelist
--whitelist.description: Whitelist of topics to include for consumption.

--batch-size.name: --batch-size
--batch-size.description: Number of messages to send in a single batch if they are not being sent synchronously.

--broker-list.name: --broker-list
--broker-list.description: The Kafka broker(s) to connect to. NOTE: This'll overwrite the selected cluster value.

--line-reader.name: --line-reader
--line-reader.description: The class name of the class to use for reading lines from standard in.

--max-block-ms.name: --max-block-ms
--max-block-ms.description: The max time that the producer will block for during a send request.

--max-memory-bytes.name: --max-memory-bytes
--max-memory-bytes.description: The total memory used by the producer to buffer records waiting to be sent to the server.

--max-partition-memory-bytes.name: --max-partition-memory-bytes
--max-partition-memory-bytes.description: The buffer size allocated for a partition.

--message-send-max-retries.name: --message-send-max-retries
--message-send-max-retries.description: The number of retires before the producer will give up and drop a message.

--metadata-expiry-ms.name: --metadata-expiry-ms
--metadata-expiry-ms.description: Number of milliseconds after which we force a refresh of metadata even if we haven't seen any leadership changes.

--producer-property.name: --producer-property
--producer-property.description: A mechanism to pass user-defined properties in the form key=value to the producer.

--producer.config.name: --producer.config
--producer.config.description: Producer config properties file. Note that --producer-property takes precedence over this config.

--property.name: --property
--property.description: A mechanism to pass user-defined properties in the form key=value to the message reader.

--request-required-acks.name: --request-required-acks
--request-required-acks.description: The required acks of the producer request.

--request-timeout-ms.name: --request-timeout-ms
--request-timeout-ms.description: The ack timeout of the producer requests. Value must be non-negative.

--retry-backoff-ms.name: --retry-backoff-ms
--retry-backoff-ms.description: The amount of time the producer waits before refreshing the metadata of the topic.

--socket-buffer-size.name: --socket-buffer-size
--socket-buffer-size.description: The size of the tcp RECV size.

--sync.name: --sync
--sync.description: If set message send requests to the brokers are synchronously, one at a time as they arrive.

--timeout.name: --timeout
--timeout.description: In asynchronous mode, the maximum amount of time a message will queue awaiting sufficient batch size.

--topic.name: --topic
--topic.description: The topic to produce messages to.

--partition.name: --partition

--property.name: --property
--property.description: The properties to initialize the message formatter.

--skip-message-on-error.description: If there is an error when processing a message, skip it rather than halting.

--timeout-ms.name: --timeout-ms
--timeout-ms.description: If specified, exit if no message is available for consumption for the specified interval.

--whitelist.name: --whitelist
--whitelist.description: Whitelist of topics to include for consumption.

--max-block-ms.name: --max-block-ms
--max-block-ms.description: The max time that the producer will block for during a send request.

--max-memory-bytes.name: --max-memory-bytes
--max-memory-bytes.description: The total memory used by the producer to buffer records waiting to be sent to the server.

--max-partition-memory-bytes.name: --max-partition-memory-bytes
--max-partition-memory-bytes.description: The buffer size allocated for a partition.

--message-send-max-retries.name: --message-send-max-retries
--message-send-max-retries.description: The number of retires before the producer will give up and drop a message.

--metadata-expiry-ms.name: --metadata-expiry-ms
--metadata-expiry-ms.description: Number of milliseconds after which we force a refresh of metadata even if we haven't seen any leadership changes.

--producer-property.description: A mechanism to pass user-defined properties in the form key=value to the producer.

--request-required-acks.description: The required acks of the producer request.

--request-timeout-ms.description: The ack timeout of the producer requests. Value must be non-negative.

--retry-backoff-ms.description: The amount of time the producer waits before refreshing the metadata of the topic.

--socket-buffer-size.description: The size of the tcp RECV size.

--timeout.name: --timeout

--topic.description: The topic to produce messages to.

kafka-verifiable-consumer.name: kafka-verifiable-consumer
kafka-verifiable-consumer.description: Consume messages from a specific topic and emit consumer events.

--broker-list.name: --broker-list
--broker-list.description: The Kafka broker(s) to connect to. NOTE: This'll overwrite the selected cluster value.

--group-id.name: --group-id
--group-id.description: The group id shared among members of the consumer group.

--max-messages.name: --max-messages
--max-messages.description: The maximum number of messages to consume before exiting. Defaults to continual consumption.

--reset-policy.name: --reset-policy
--reset-policy.description: Set the reset policy. Must be 'earliest', 'latest', or 'none'. Default: earliest.

kafka-verifiable-producer.name: kafka-verifiable-producer
kafka-verifiable-producer.description: Produce increasing integers messages to the specified topic and emit producer events.

--broker-list.name: --broker-list
--broker-list.description: The Kafka broker(s) to connect to. NOTE: This'll overwrite the selected cluster value.

--max-messages.name: --max-messages
--max-messages.description: The maximum number of messages to producer before exiting. Defaults to continual production.

--throughput.name: --throughput
--throughput.description: Throttle maximum message throughput to *approximately* this messages/sec.

--acks.name: --acks
--acks.description: Acks required on each produced message. Default: -1.

--message-create-time.name: --message-create-time
--message-create-time.description: Send messages with creation time starting at this value, in milliseconds since epoch.

--value-prefix.name: --value-prefix
--value-prefix.description: Each produced value will have this prefix with a dot separator.

--repeating-keys.name: --repeating-keys
--repeating-keys.description: Each produced record key will increment from 0 until this number, and then start at 0 again.

kafka-consumer-groups.name: kafka-consumer-groups
kafka-consumer-groups.description: Manage consumer groups within a cluster.

--all-topics.name: --all-topics
--all-topics.description: Consider all topics assigned to a group in the 'reset-offsets' process.

--bootstrap-server.name: --bootstrap-server
--bootstrap-server.description: The Kafka broker(s) to connect to. NOTE: This'll overwrite the selected cluster value.

--by-duration.name: --by-duration
--by-duration.description: Reset offsets to offset by duration from current timestamp. Format: 'PnDTnHnMnS'.

--command-config.name: --command-config
--command-config.description: Property file containing configs to be passed to admin client and consumer.

--delete.name: --delete
--delete.description: Delete topic partition offsets and ownership info over the entire consumer group.

--describe.name: --describe
--describe.description: Describe consumer group and list offset lag for the consumer group.

--dry-run.name: --dry-run
--dry-run.description: Show results without executing changes. Supported for '--reset-offsets'.

--export.name: --export
--export.description: Export operation execution to a CSV file. Supported for '--reset-offsets'.

--from-file.name: --from-file
--from-file.description: Reset offsets to values defined in CSV file.

--group.name: --group
--group.description: The consumer group to act on.

--members.name: --members
--members.description: Describe members of the given consumer group.

--offsets.name: --offsets
--offsets.description: Describe group and list all topic partitions in the group along with their offset lag.

--reset-offsets.name: --reset-offsets
--reset-offsets.description: Reset offsets of consumer group. Supports one group at a time.

--shift-by.name: --shift-by
--shift-by.description: Reset offsets shifting current offset by 'n' where 'n' is positive or negative.

--timeout.name: --timeout
--timeout.description: The timeout that can be set for some use cases.

--to-datetime.name: --to-datetime
--to-datetime.description: Reset offsets to offset from datetime. Format: 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:SS.sss'.

--to-offset.name: --to-offset
--to-offset.description: Reset offsets to a specific offset.

--topic.name: --topic
--topic.description: The topic whose consumer group information should be acted upon.

--verbose.name: --verbose
--verbose.description: Provide additional information, if any, when describing the group.

kafka-acls.name: kafka-acls
kafka-acls.description: Manage access control lists within a cluster.

--add.name: --add
--add.description: Indicates you want to add ACLs.

--allow-host.name: --allow-host
--allow-host.description: Host from which principals listed in --allow-principal will have access.

--allow-principal.name: --allow-principal
--allow-principal.description: Principal to allow in the principalType:name format.

--authorizer.name: --authorizer
--authorizer.description: Fully qualified class name of the authorizer.

--authorizer-properties.name: --authorizer-properties
--authorizer-properties.description: Properties required to configure an instance of the authorizer. Format: key=value.

--bootstrap-server.name: --bootstrap-server
--bootstrap-server.description: The Kafka broker(s) to connect to. NOTE: This'll overwrite the selected cluster value.

--command-config.name: --command-config
--command-config.description: A property file containing configs to be passed to the admin client.

--consumer.name: --consumer
--consumer.description: Convenience option to add or remove ACLs for the consumer role.

--delegation-token.name: --delegation-token
--delegation-token.description: Delegation token to which ACLs should be added or removed.

--deny-host.name: --deny-host
--deny-host.description: Host from which principals listed in --deny-principal will be denied access.

--deny-principal.name: --deny-principal
--deny-principal.description: Principal to deny in the principalType:name format.

--force.name: --force
--force.description: Assume yes for all queries and do not prompt.

--group.name: --group
--group.description: Consumer Group to which the ACLs should be added or removed.

--idempotent.name: --idempotent
--idempotent.description: Enable idempotence for the producer. Used with '--producer'.

--list.name: --list
--list.description: List ACLs for the specified resource.

--operation.name: --operation
--operation.description: Operation that is being allowed or denied.

--principal.name: --principal
--principal.description: List ACLs for the specified principal.

--producer.name: --producer
--producer.description: Convenience option to add or remove ACLs for producer role.

--remove.name: --remove
--remove.description: Indicates you are trying to remove ACLs.

--resource-pattern-type.name: --resource-pattern-type
--resource-pattern-type.description: The type of the resource pattern or pattern filter. Default: LITERAL.

--topic.name: --topic
--topic.description: Topic for which ACLs should be added or removed.

--transactional-id.name: --transactional-id
--transactional-id.description: The transactionalId to which ACLs should be added or removed.

kafka-replica-verification.name: kafka-replica-verification
kafka-replica-verification.description: Validate that all replicas for a set of topics have the same data.

--broker-list.name: --broker-list
--broker-list.description: The Kafka broker(s) to connect to. NOTE: This'll overwrite the selected cluster value.

--fetch-size.name: --fetch-size
--fetch-size.description: The fetch size of each request in bytes. Default: 1048576.

--max-wait-ms.name: --max-wait-ms
--max-wait-ms.description: The max amount of time each fetch request waits. Default: 1000.

--time.name: --time
--time.description: Timestamp for getting the initial offsets. Default: -1.

--topic-white-list.name: --topic-white-list
--topic-white-list.description: Whitelist of topics to verify replica consistency using Java regex. Default: '.*'.

--bootstrap-server.name: --bootstrap-server
--bootstrap-server.description: The Kafka broker(s) to connect to. NOTE: This'll overwrite the selected cluster value.

--command-config.name: --command-config
--command-config.description: Property file containing configs to be passed to the admin client.

kafka-delete-records.name: kafka-delete-records
kafka-delete-records.description: Delete records of the given partitions down to the specified offset.

--bootstrap-server.name: --bootstrap-server
--bootstrap-server.description: The Kafka broker(s) to connect to. NOTE: This'll overwrite the selected cluster value.

--command-config.name: --command-config
--command-config.description: Property file containing configs to be passed to the admin client.

--offset-json-file.name: --offset-json-file
--offset-json-file.description: The JSON file with offset per partition.

kafka-log-dirs.name: kafka-log-dirs
kafka-log-dirs.description: Query log directory usage on specified brokers.

--bootstrap-server.name: --bootstrap-server
--bootstrap-server.description: The Kafka broker(s) to connect to. NOTE: This'll overwrite the selected cluster value.

--broker-list.name: --broker-list
--broker-list.description: The list of brokers to be queried in the form '0,1,2'. Default: all.

--command-config.name: --command-config
--command-config.description: Property file containing configs to be passed to the admin client.

--describe.name: --describe
--describe.description: Describe the specified log directories on the specified brokers.

--topic-list.name: --topic-list
--topic-list.description: The list of topics to be queried in the form 'topic1,topic2,topic3'. Default: all.

kafka-dump-log.name: kafka-dump-log
kafka-dump-log.description: Parse a log file and dump its contents to the console.

--deep-iteration.name: --deep-iteration
--deep-iteration.description: Use deep instead of shallow iteration. Automatically set when using '--print-data-log'.

--files.name: --files
--files.description: Comma-separated list of data and index log files to be dumped.

--index-sanity-check.name: --index-sanity-check
--index-sanity-check.description: Check the index sanity without printing its content.

--key-decoder-class.name: --key-decoder-class
--key-decoder-class.description: Used to deserialize the keys. Default: kafka.serializer.StringDecoder.

--offsets-decoder.name: --offsets-decoder
--offsets-decoder.description: Parse log data as offset data from the __consumer_offsets topic.

--print-data-log.name: --print-data-log
--print-data-log.description: Print the messages content when dumping data log. Automatically set when using any decoder option.

--transaction-log-decoder.name: --transaction-log-decoder
--transaction-log-decoder.description: Parse log data as transaction metadata from the __transaction_state topic.

--value-decoder-class.name: --value-decoder-class
--value-decoder-class.description: Used to deserialize the messages. Default: kafka.serializer.StringDecoder.

--verify-index-only.name: --verify-index-only
--verify-index-only.description: Verify the index log without printing its content.

--config-file.name: --config-file
--config-file.description: File specifying configs for KSQL and its underlying Kafka Streams instance(s).

--output.name: --output
--output.description: The output format to use (JSON or TABULAR). TABULAR by default.

--query-row-limit.name: --query-row-limit
--query-row-limit.description: An optional maximum number of rows to read from streamed queries.

--query-timeout.name: --query-timeout
--query-timeout.description: An optional time limit (in milliseconds) for streamed queries.

--.description: Used to override the KSQL server. i.e. '-- http://localhost:8088'.
